Class MenuBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.landrycarroll.leaflog.infrastructure.MenuBuilder
public class MenuBuilder extends Object
MenuBuilder is a utility class for building and displaying a CLI-based menu. It enables developers to register menu options with corresponding Runnable actions, and allows users to select options through indexed input.

The menu is displayed in a loop until the user chooses to exit. This class is particularly useful for CLI-driven applications where user interaction is required.

Example usage:


 new MenuBuilder(io)
     .addOption("Add Plant", addPlantController)
     .addOption("List Plants", listPlantsController)
     .build();

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuBuilder

      public MenuBuilder(UserIO io)
      Constructs a new MenuBuilder with the specified I/O handler.
      Parameters:
      io - the UserIO interface used for input/output operations

  • Method Details

    • addOption

      public MenuBuilder addOption(String option, Runnable controller)
      Adds a new option to the menu.
      Parameters:
      option - the label to display in the menu
      controller - the action to execute when the option is selected
      Returns:
      the current instance of MenuBuilder for fluent chaining

    • build

      public void build()
      Builds and displays the menu in a loop. Users can select options by number. Selecting the final option (Exit) ends the loop and exits the menu.
